CANDIDATE 		Peter Hohaus
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location:		Germany – Berlin
QUALIFICATIONS
May 1995 1st State Law Examination, Düsseldorf
Law studies Ruhr-University Bochum 1994
Optional subject: Private International Law and Comparative Law. July 1993: Summer Course in English Legal Methods, University of Cambridge.
Languages
German: Mother tongue
English: Fluent
French: Basic
Russian: Basic
CAREER SUMMARY
Jan 2016 to Nov 2018 Uniper SE
Dec 2018 to date

Group-wide coordination of political relevant procedures in the course of implementing the German hydrogen strategy (e.g. Uniper's positioning for a new regulatory  CANDIDATE 		Peter Hohaus
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location:		Germany – Berlin
QUALIFICATIONS
May 1995 1st State Law Examination, Düsseldorf
Law studies Ruhr-University Bochum 1994
Optional subject: Private International Law and Comparative Law. July 1993: Summer Course in English Legal Methods, University of Cambridge.
Languages
German: Mother tongue
English: Fluent
French: Basic
Russian: Basic
CAREER SUMMARY
Jan 2016 to Nov 2018 Uniper SE
Dec 2018 to date
Position: Deputy Head of the Representative Office
Further development of Uniper's positioning in the political sphere.
In particular, flanking gas-specific and international topics.
Group-wide coordination of political relevant procedures in the course of implementing the German hydrogen strategy (e.g. Uniper's positioning for a new regulatory framework for the development of hydrogen networks).
Political support for Uniper's Russia business. Support for individual commercial projects, in particular the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline; political support for the Russian subsidiary Unipro on issues relating to the capacity market in the Russian electricity sector.
Responsibility for Uniper's membership in the German Eastern Business Association and the German-Russian Forum. Advisor to the Chief Executive Officer for his mandates in the German Eastern Business Association (Management Board and Presidium). Advisor to the Chairman of the Supervisory Board of Uniper for his mandate in the German-Russian Forum (Advisory Board).
Networking with relevant contacts: Federal Foreign Office, Federal Chancellery, Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Climate Action, German Parliament, associations, think tanks, foundations, civil society organizations, embassies of other states, etc.
Coordinator of risk management for the Uniper Corporate Communication and Governmental Relations division.
Jan 2016 to Nov 2018
Position: Senior Policy Advisor
Strategic positioning of Uniper in the political sphere. Active flanking of natural gas-specific and international issues.
Advisor to the Chief Executive Officer and the Chairman of the Supervisory Board of Uniper for mandates in the German Eastern Business Association and the German-Russian Forum.
Political support for Uniper’s business with Russia. Support for individual commercial projects, e.g. Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline project.
Dec 2010 to March 2012 E.ON AG, Düsseldorf
Position: Policy Advisor, Department Political Affairs & Corporate Communications
Active political flanking of natural gas-specific topics in Brussels and Berlin.
Energy policy support for individual commercial projects, e.g. Trans Adriatic Pipeline ("Southern Gas Corridor").
Sept 2009 to Dec 2010 E.ON Ruhrgas AG, Essen
Position: Head of German and International Energy Law, European Law and Gas Associations EU
Advisor to all departments of the company and its subsidiaries on German and international energy law and European law.
Advisor and representative of the Chief Legal Officer at meetings of the Legal Committee of the Eurogas Association. Member Eurogas Task Force Security of Gas Supply.
Dec 2007 to Sept 2009 Eurogas, Brusseles Senior Manager Legal & Regulatory Affairs
Position: Advisor to the Secretary General and the Deputy Secretary General.
Coordinator and advisor of Eurogas Policy Committees (e.g. Strategy Committee, System Users Committee) and Legal Affairs Committee; coordinator of political positions in collaboration with member companies.
Representative of Eurogas in discussions with EU institutions (Commission, European Parliament, Council) and other stakeholder groups. Several appearances as speaker in the Gas Coordination Group.
Oct 2003 to Dec 2007 E.ON Ruhrgas AG, Essen
Position: Head of German and International Energy Law, European Law and Gas Associations EU
Advisor to all departments of the company and its subsidiaries on German and international energy law and European law.
Negotiator for E.ON Ruhrgas in the BGW legal association-group on the first cooperation agreement between German network operators.
Advisor to the Chief Legal Officer in the preparation of meetings of the Legal Committee of the Eurogas Association.
Jan 2001 to Oct 2003 Ruhrgas Aktiengesellsch

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
